Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style or Grand Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky dark brown (partly worn) with bands in added white and red; exterior: two brown bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Bands on the cul of chalices appear as early as 610BC and last until circa 550BC. Chalice kraters however, are found in the Mature Animal Style and Grand Styles.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1621) (phase 2)
